org.openimaj.hadoop.tools.twitter.token.mode.pointwisemi.count

Class TokenPairUnaryCount

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.openimaj.util.pair.IndependentPair<T,T>
      • org.openimaj.util.pair.Pair<String>
        • org.openimaj.hadoop.tools.twitter.token.mode.pointwisemi.count.TokenPairCount
          • org.openimaj.hadoop.tools.twitter.token.mode.pointwisemi.count.TokenPairUnaryCount
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Readable, ReadableASCII, ReadableBinary, ReadWriteable, Writeable, WriteableASCII, WriteableBinary

    public class TokenPairUnaryCount
extends TokenPairCount
    A Pair count with a unary count for each item of the pair. The values here are the 3 counting functions: c(x,y) = Number of times the pair x and y were seen together c(x) = Number of times x was seen with ANY other token c(y) = Number of times y was seen with ANY other token
    Author:
    Sina Samangooei (ss@ecs.soton.ac.uk)

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      double pmi(double n)
      Calculate the Pointwise mutual information score such that: PMI(x,y) = log( p(x,y) / ( p(x) p(y) ) ) where we can estimate the probabilities as: p(x,y) = c(x,y) / n p(x) = c(x) / n p(y) = c(y) / n where n is the total number of pairs observed
      void readASCII(Scanner in)
      Read internal state from in.
      void readBinary(DataInput in)
      Read internal state from in.

      Write the content of this as ascii to out.
      void writeBinary(DataOutput out)
      Write the content of this as binary to out.

      • TokenPairUnaryCount

        public TokenPairUnaryCount(String tok1,
                           String tok2,
                           long paircount,
                           long tok1count,
                           long tok2count)
        Parameters:
        tok1 - the first token (x)
        tok2 - the second token (y)
        paircount - the count of the tokens together (c(x,y))
        tok1count - the count of the first token with any other token (c(x))
        tok2count - the count of the second token with any other token (c(y))

      • pmi

        public double pmi(double n)
        Calculate the Pointwise mutual information score such that: PMI(x,y) = log( p(x,y) / ( p(x) p(y) ) ) where we can estimate the probabilities as: p(x,y) = c(x,y) / n p(x) = c(x) / n p(y) = c(y) / n where n is the total number of pairs observed
        Parameters:
        n - the total number of pairs observed
        Returns:
        the PMI estimate
